https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Experimental mineralogy and petrology are the Earth science disciplines that model or simulate mineralogical, petrological, and geochemical processes within the laboratory in order to understand the physical and chemical properties of minerals, rocks, melts, and fluids and their interactions.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition from:
Geiger, CA and Kawamoto, T 2017, Experimental Mineralogy and Petrology, Encyclopedia of Geochemistry, Encyclopedia of Earth Sciences Series, edited by W White: Springer, Cham, doi.org/10.1007/978-3-319-39193-9_311-2.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Experimental mineralogy and petrology are the Earth science disciplines that model or simulate mineralogical, petrological, and geochemical processes within the laboratory in order to understand the physical and chemical properties of minerals, rocks, melts, and fluids and their interactions.
